problem.p: An engineer is in a competition to launch a pumpkin as high as possible using a launching device that must be kept within a certain height. Because of the height restriction, the engineer wants to accelerate the pumpkin to a large speed before releasing it.

The engineer decides a good way to get the pumpkin moving fast is to attach the pumpkin to the edge of a vertical wheel turned by a motor. When the wheel is turning as fast as possible at its constant rate w, the pumpkin is released so that it goes straight upwards (see figure).
If during the competition the pumpkin reaches a maximum height H from where it was released, what was the angular velocity w of the wheel? Use g, H, and R in your answer.
